## Setup
### Clean workspace, set options, load data
```{r start clean and load data}
rm(list=ls())
options(stringsAsFactors=FALSE)
genedf = readRDS("data/genedf.rds")

# look at the first few genes
genedf[1:5,]
```

## Subsetting to specific genes
### One gene of interest
```{r x}
# set a specific gene name, this should be the official _A. burtoni_ gene symbol
xgene = "ar"

# is it present at all in `genedf`?
# `genedf$geneSym` accesses the column in `genedf` that has the name `geneSym`
#   there are other ways to access columns in a data frame, but I prefer `$` notation because it's explicit
head(genedf$geneSym)
# `genedf$geneSym == xgene` creates a vector of logical/boolean values
#   entry _i_ corresponds to row(_i_) in `genedf`
head(genedf$geneSym == xgene)

# create a vector testing whether entries in `genedf$geneSym` are the value stored in `xgene`,
#   then check whether any entries are TRUE
xgeneLogicalVec = genedf$geneSym == xgene
xgenePres = any(xgeneLogicalVec)
xgenePres

# sometimes we may want the exact row number 
xgeneRow = which(xgenePres)
xgeneRow

# multiple ways of accessing the row in `genedf` for the gene name stored in `xgene`
genedf[xgeneLogicalVec, ]
genedf[xgeneRow, ]
genedf[genedf$geneSym == xgene, ]
subset(genedf, geneSym == xgene)
```
